instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no post, image, dong - turns on
threads.message:
Hi guys,
Another MacBook Air - clean, no liquid, absolutely clean board, first person working on it, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 11" turns on sees battery, does SMC reset if keys pressed, no post, dong, image - doesn't react if trying PRAM, 
Checked voltages around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and missing <SIGNAL>SPI_MLB_CLK</SIGNAL>, traced back to <RESISTOR>R6121</RESISTOR> -> <RESISTOR>R6111</RESISTOR> Pin1 receives it from <CHIP>U0500</CHIP>, any signals I can check for it in order to shoot out clock signal?
Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no post, image, dong - turns on
threads.message:
" [h=2]no post, image, dong"[/h] Does this mean none present???
Or you get image and dong?

Do you get VCORE and <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?
Did you try known good BIOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no post, image, dong - turns on
threads.message:
Sorry for confusion - I don't get none of the 3 - no image, no dong, no post, tried USB mouse/keyboard on both USB ports,
I get 3.33V for <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and VCORE is 1.8V
I tried BIOS of the donor board, but same result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no post, image, dong - turns on
threads.message:
Try changing SMC.
If still the same, probably bad CPU...
